name: AddReactionToTrelloAction
description:
Add a reaction to a Trello action.

Use this tool to add a new reaction to a specific action within Trello. It should be called when you want to express feedback or sentiment on an action item on Trello.

parameters.name: action_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Trello action to which you want to add a reaction.

parameters.name: emoji_short_name
parameters.description: The short name of the emoji to add as a reaction, like 'thumbsup' or 'smile'.

value_schema.description: The primary `shortName` of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)

parameters.name: emoji_skin_variation
parameters.description: Specifies the `skinVariation` for the emoji being added as a reaction, like default or medium-light.

value_schema.description: The `skinVariation` of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)

parameters.name: native_emoji_unicode
parameters.description: The native unicode emoji to add as a reaction. It should be a valid emoji character.

value_schema.description: The emoji to add as a native unicode emoji. See [/emoji](#emoji)

parameters.name: emoji_unified_value
parameters.description: The `unified` value of the emoji to add to the Trello action. This is a code representing the emoji and is used to specify the exact emoji to add.

value_schema.description: The `unified` value of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the trello API.

parameters.name: shortName
parameters.description: The primary `shortName` of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)

value_schema.description: The primary `shortName` of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)

parameters.name: skinVariation
parameters.description: The `skinVariation` of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)

value_schema.description: The `skinVariation` of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)

parameters.name: native
parameters.description: The emoji to add as a native unicode emoji. See [/emoji](#emoji)

value_schema.description: The emoji to add as a native unicode emoji. See [/emoji](#emoji)

parameters.name: unified
parameters.description: The `unified` value of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)

value_schema.description: The `unified` value of the emoji to add. See [/emoji](#emoji)
